IMAGEDESCRIPTION.free_text: Multi-tilt EM tomogram of primary human small airway epithelial cell (SAEC) in interphase state. The tomogram refers to the SAEC in figure S8 of the published manuscript: http://science.sciencemag.org/content/357/6349/eaag0025.

TECHNICALDETAILS.free_text: Primary human small airway epithelial cells in interphase state were fixed with 2.5% glutaraldehyde, 5 mM CaCl<sub>2</sub> in 0.1 M sodium cacodylate buffer (pH 7.4). Cells were stained with 10 µM DRAQ5, and photo-oxidized at 620 ± 30 nm for 8 minutes. Cells were post-fixed with 2% osmium tetroxide, 2 mM CaCl<sub>2</sub>, 1.5% potassium ferrocyanide in 0.15 M sodium cacodylate buffer (pH 7.4). Samples were ethanol dehydrated, embedded in Durcupan epoxy resin and sectioned to 250 nm thickness and mounted on copper slot grid. 5 nm and 10 nm colloidal gold particles were deposited on the grid as fiducial markers. 8-tilt EM tomography was collected on a 300 kV FEI Titan Krios using a 4K by 4K Gatan Ultrascan CCD camera at 1 degree increment for each tilt series from -60° to +60°. The entire set of EMT images was aligned and reconstructed using the Transform-based Tracking, Bundle adjustment, and Reconstruction (TXBR) package. The data has a voxel size of 2.04 nm.

BIOLOGICALPROCESS.free_text: Primary human small airway epithelial cells in interphase state

NCBIORGANISMALCLASSIFICATION.free_text: Primary human small airway epithelial cells immortalized with telomerase

PREPARATION.free_text: Glutaraldehyde fixed cells, photo-oxidation of DRAQ5 in the presence of DAB solution to induce DAB polymerization and subsequent staining with osmium tetroxide

SOURCEOFCONTRAST.free_text: Osmium tetroxide staining of DAB polymers catalyzed by photo-oxidation of DRAQ5 stained cells in the presence of DAB solution

Citation.Title: Horng Ou, Sebastien Phan, Thomas Deerinck, Andrea Thor, Mark Ellisman, Clodagh O’Shea (2017) CIL:49952, Primary human small airway epithelial cells immortalized with telomerase. CIL. Dataset
